about.description:
Hey, I am a Master’s student in Computer Engineering, currently strengthening my foundation in hardware design and systems. During my undergraduate studies, I concentrated on software development and machine learning, and toward the end of my degree, I shifted my focus toward controls and robotics—an intersection that allows me to combine both software expertise and hardware knowledge.

Outside of academics, I enjoy working on independent projects that broaden my technical skills. I also pursue personal interests such as coin collecting and language learning, which reflect my curiosity and commitment to continuous growth.

Right now, I am looking to get an industrial experience focused on the hardware side and therefore I am looking for a Spring/Summer internship for next year

projects.name: Robot Cello - VIP
projects.description: I set up a gazebo simulation environment for a robot arm to play the cello using ROS2 and MoveIt2 and then built a position controller for the arm to follow published end effector trajectories. I then processed Mocap data of a human playing the cello to generate the trajectories for the robot arm to follow.

projects.name: GitHub Workflows Security Vulnerability Tool - VIP
projects.description: I co-led a team investigating vulnerabilities in GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows and evaluating the scope of existing security tools in industry. Designed and implemented a custom analysis tool that uncovered previously hidden vulnerabilities in a significant number of repositories.

projects.name: This Website (Angular Portfolio)
projects.description: The website is built using Angular and styled with Tailwind CSS to showcase off my experiences, skills and projects while giving me a learning experience of AngularJS

projects.name: Custom Evaluation Board with ESP-32
projects.description: Designed, fabricated and wrote firmware for a custom evaluation board using the ESP-32 micro-controller and Arduino Mega footprint

projects.name: Deep Learning Q&A Chatbot using Tensorflow
projects.description: A story-based Q&A bot based on the BaBi dataset using basic NLP through Tensorflow. An end-to-end memory-based recurrent neural network implementation with multiple layers.

projects.name: Autonomous Drone Controls Algorithm - VIP
projects.description: I worked with a team in integrating the computer vision algorithm in the controls algorithm for autonoumous navigation of a drone through a miniature city. I also worked on setting up a simulation of the miniature city as well as designing and 3D printing propellor guards

projects.name: Conference Paper titled 'A Self-Adapting Wheel System for Space Exploration Rovers'
projects.description: Co-authored a paper on an efficient wheel system for space exploration rovers that would reduce instances of slipping and sinkage and presented it at the International Astronautical Congress 2021 in Dubai, UAE.

projects.name: 1971 Ford Escort Mk1 Restoration
projects.description: Got a non-working classic car working after a complete teardown and rebuild of the engine with a focus on the carburettor as well as the electical systems

experiences.description: I support four cross-disciplinary VIP teams by handling course operations — assignment schedules, deliverable timelines, rubrics, and progress tracking — and ensuring submissions meet program standards. I also serve as the technical mentor for the RoboMaster team, advising on system integration, controls, and debugging, and reviewing designs and code to keep milestones on track.

I worked with NVIDIA Omniverse Toolkit to build the graphical components to interact with Digital Twins through Universal Scene Description applications. I built on the Model-View-Controller methodology in NVIDIA GDN

I worked on various ML concepts along with full stack development in the FERN stack of Firebase, Express, React and Node. Right now I am integrating a custom Llama2 model with a Vector DB through LangChain for help and context through a chatbot. I set up several CI/CD pipelines with Kubernetes Engine in GCP to publish apps and python services and configured services using Pub-Sub and Cloud Functions to transcribe and extract contexts through public LLMs.

I worked on integrating event cameras with respective hardware and improving Vision-based UAV algorithms. I worked with the team to generate a synthetic data set for training ML algorithms by designing intelligent dynamic Gazebo worlds. I was also a Summer Undergraduate Research Fellow during the summer and learned the research process while executing literature search and produced a research paper at the end.

I supported several undergraduate course by holding regular office hours to guide students through labs and homework, designing and grading assignments and exams, and developing Python-based autograders to streamline and standardize evaluation. Improved both turnaround time and consistency in grading while providing students with timely, detailed feedback.
